data.q: Which function retrieves the value of an environment variable?
data.e: os.getenv('VAR_NAME') returns the value of the specified environment variable or None if not set.

data.q: Which attribute provides direct access to all environment variables as a dictionary?
data.e: os.environ is a dictionary-like object containing the current environment variables.

data.q: Which method sets a new environment variable in Python?
data.e: Assigning to os.environ['VAR'] sets or updates an environment variable.

data.q: Which function removes an environment variable?
data.e: Deleting the key from os.environ removes the environment variable.

o: Sets the value of an environment variable
Copies environment variables to a file
data.e: os.putenv(key, value) sets the value of an environment variable for the current process.

data.q: Which environment variable typically stores the system PATH?
data.e: PATH contains directories searched for executable programs.

data.q: Which environment variable specifies the user’s home directory?
data.e: HOME points to the current user’s home directory.

data.q: Which environment variable can be used to add custom module search paths in Python?
data.e: PYTHONPATH specifies additional directories to search for Python modules.

data.q: Which function can be used to copy the current environment variables for subprocesses?
data.e: os.environ.copy() returns a dictionary copy of the current environment variables.

data.q: Which environment variable indicates the current working directory?
data.e: PWD stores the path of the current working directory in Unix-like systems.
